comment: Nice straight and I bet it would be nice with an ice cube. Would make a good old fashioned!
Corn on the nose, with green wood and more corn on the palate with a sweeter, mild finish of corn and vanilla.  Not bad, but less complex, and green.
Nice color, notes of honey, vanilla, oak. No fruit notes. Alcohol heavy bouquet. I would buy a bottle.
Somewhat harsh. Not sweet. Not complex.
A little harsh on the front but sweet.
Sweet, corn, butter, oil. Bit of cinnamon. Short fleeting finish.
Smooth and sweet. A few shots at Stamper’s in C Springs CO

Caramel candy, buttered popcorn and oak touch the nose. Vanilla and spice make a late but welcome entrance. Young corn and spice on the tongue. Vanilla and maple with a touch of chocolate and brine. For being so young, the corn isn’t as forward as one might expect. A finish of coffee lingers. As it breathes, grass and mint make a late appearance.
Very smooth, no heat, anise, woody.
Anise, fresh wood, complex, smooth. Solid.
Not a bad sipper. Light finish and good pallet.
This is a good (but not great) standard bourbon. A little bite but mostly sweet with hints of buttered and sugared sweet corn (like Mexican street corn)
We had the Port Cask Finish and it was incredibly smooth

Nose: oak and corn.
Palate: nice richness, caramel and some spice. Finish is quick with just a little burn down the back of the throat. Rocks bring out a hit of pepper as the burn disappears.
Sweet and smoky at the end
first taste was not so good. tasted sour & flat. next taste brought a little more flavor & a touch more sweetness, but still lacking for me.
No burn. Pretty mild overall actually

Opened 6/19

Even though they blend their young bourbon with more mature barrels from other distilleries you can tell it is large percentage of the blend. Overall it is a descent pour but I won’t be rushing out to get the brands other offerings.

In agreement with the provided tasting notes. This is good, and potentially VERY good, but more time in the barrel definitely won’t hurt. 

But don’t take my word for it, open one up and find out for yourself.
Young. Plenty of vanilla on the nose. Some spices in the mouth but disappointing given the aroma. This had a hard finish for me. More promise than delivery.
no depth. some honey and fruit but empty and thin. bad finish with a lack of years and a tad too much heat.
breckenridge bourbon august 2019 w jana at olde lagoon saloon. Vanilla sweet butterscotch. nose. But very bland no punch. Grass? Not citricy. Little spicy. Surpisngly no flavor or punch.

Neat from a Glencairn glass

Not a whole lot going on in the nose. Ethanol, vanilla and cinnamon. 

Slight burn on the palate with more vanilla and a slight fruity hit, maybe strawberry. 

Finish is quick and to the point, more vanilla and hint of oak. Smooth throughout though. 

My wife bought this for me and I was very skeptical. Given some more time in the barrel and higher proof, I think this could be a solid pour. But for the price, there’s much better stuff out there.
One of my favorites. Great pour. Little spicy.
Sweet smell. I get honey or maple. The taste is sweet with honey again being the major note I get. Maybe some vanilla. Not much spice to me. Goes down pretty smooth.
This was a gift from a friend. I think it’s an outstanding bourbon. Totally surprised me.

Decent bourbon. Quite smooth and not spicy. But less interesting than I prefer. 

Store tasting
Sweet and floral on the nose, hints of apples, cinnamon. On the mouth, pepper, citrus, vanilla, oak.
Sweet. A little spicy on the front of the tongue and going down. Overall would drink again.
Very hot. Order on the rocks next time or as an old fashioned. Depending on the price point and other options.
Vanilla on the nose and tongue.  A bit of caramel.  Fairly sweet.  Very drinkable.
Bought on sale for $10 off at VABC
So much vanilla. Banana. Low heat. Easy drinker. Great Nose!
Middle of the road in all things
A little spicy and vanilla in the nose.  More complex sweet flavors, vanilla again but balanced with other sweet notes.  Good, but short in the finish, which is the weakness of the whisky.
Sweet and smooth. I like it.
A perfectly nice, light drinking bourbon - a summer bourbon, if you will. Doesn't have great complexity, but nice and smooth.
Carmel and vanilla stand out first. Is a little hot but still somewhat smooth
Barley forward, hint of orange, dry.
Sweet but scotch like barley taste.
Awful flavor, first bourbon I’ve ever dumped down the drain (one glass). making vanilla extract out of this!
White pepper, dried fruit, vanilla, and oak on the the nose. Corn, oak, and honey on tongue. Smooth finish.

N - spiced bread honey

P -  vanilla frosting baking spice

F - Very short
Easy to drink for everyday bourbon

I’ve tasted worse but it’s like Maple Syrup sweet. I could drink it but I’m sure the bar has better than this. 

Maybe in a breakfast Old Fashioned?
Almost too smooth. Thin and Light ina good way. Easy drinker
Get some toast and cinnamon on the nose. Short finish but overall pretty good.

Nose is strong sweet vanilla and oak. Palate is also sweet with a hint of spiciness. Finish is shallow but smooth. Typically goes for around 50 but I picked up my bottle for 33. Good for 33 bucks, don’t think I’d pay 50.
Buttery toast on the front end, corn on the back. Smooth finish but the flavor profile isn't in line with mine. Really light barrel flavor.
Nose is cherry and almonds. Bourbon is smooth and sweet and light and not much oak.
Like it alot. The price is higher than it should be.
Heavy on the cinnamon like a bougie Fireball

Golden honey color 

Honey, oak, and alcohol nose

Thin body with cinnamon, honey, and a bitof corn flavor 

Baking spice finish
Oakey, fruity. I got notes of apple, very sweet. Initially smooth and burn once swallowed. Wouldnt buy, just meh.
Nose fades over time and becomes an easy drinker. Not a stand out bourbon. Honey on the nose with some dried cherry. Finished flat on the palette. Some honey and brown sugar notes.
To much corn flavor for my taste.
Spicy— a little burn but still smooth

Nose: Sweet, dusty corn.  Oak and char.  Mint, thyme, lemon oil - there's a green, vegetal thing going on that's hard to put my finger on.  Bananas and strawberries.  Red bell peppers maybe?  Fresh, warm rye bread.  Icing.

Palate: Sweet, dusty corn, barrel, dusty leatherbound books.  Honey, oranges, toasted grains.  A little floral.  Tannic.  Medium-light mouthfeel.  Finish starts with a surge of tannin texture, but the dusty corn and barrel stick around, along with honeysuckle.  The oak and corn stick around, mint fades in and out, and then eventually you have very mid-palate focused flavors.  Finish is medium short.

Other notes: A good example of potential.  I want this to be more on all fronts - more body, denser flavors, heavier mouthfeel.  It's not bad, mind, just not the big, punchy, complex flavors bourbon can aspire to these days.  That being said, this would appeal to somebody looking to step up from their usual Jim Beam white label and find their gateway into the rest of bourbon.
Pleasant spice, cinnamon, vanilla, caramel, sweet throughout, thin mouthfeel with a short slight spice finish.
Nose of sweet butter and bread. Basic brown sugar flavor. Flat finish. Not bad, but nothing special. Definitely not worth a premium over $25 bourbons.
Nothing too special here. Not a bad sipping whiskey but you can definitely spend a fraction of the money and get a bottle of buffalo trace or Evan Williams.
Crisp, clean, refreshing taste. A hint of spice in the aftertaste but relatively smooth given the lack of aging.
Crisp, clean, refreshing with a bit of spice in the aftertaste. Relatively smooth for the lack of aging.
Delicious from start to finish. Smells like maple and brown sugar, has a nice little spice to it at the end with a very full and rich flavor.
Thin mouthfeel; cinnamon and oak; almost so lightly sweet that it reminds me of a wheated bourbon. Easy dessert-sweet drinker.
Smell is alcohol, honey, and oranges.  Taste is blood orange and alcohol and burns on the tongue. Mouthfeel is heavy and pleasant.  Finish is bitter.  Not my favorite.
Sweet notes that include honey and some vanilla.  Strong bite afterwards.
Sweet at first contact. Very warm going down.
Very light nose. Sweet with a slight burn.
Nice, crisp, sweet with aromas of oak and vanilla.  I liked it with a little ice in a hot day.
what a nice bourbon - vanilla, toffee, hits all the right notes
